instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840 No Boot missing PP5v_S5
threads.message:
Board smells of shampoo but cant actually see any corrosion, charger was reading 5v replaced u7000 now reading 20v but 0.03a.
PP5v_s5/4 = 0v 
PP3v3_s5 =0v
G3H = 13v

threads.title: 820-00840 No Boot missing PP5v_S5
threads.message:
Any liquid sign around U7800, or CPU?

Check PP3V3_LDO3V and PMIC_SHUTDOWN_L.

threads.title: 820-00840 No Boot missing PP5v_S5
threads.message:
No signs of liquid anywhere near cpu, 

PMIC_SHUTDOWN_L = 0v
PP3V3_LDO3V = 0v

threads.title: 820-00840 No Boot missing PP5v_S5
threads.message:
Check around U7800 (7 OF 10), page 60.
As you have two identical boards, compare diode mode readings.

threads.title: 820-00840 No Boot missing PP5v_S5
threads.message: C738 is measuring low, removed cap and tested same result. Replace U7800?

threads.title: 820-00840 No Boot missing PP5v_S5
threads.message: I cannot find C738 in schematic...

threads.title: 820-00840 No Boot missing PP5v_S5
threads.message:
1V25_VREF is not connected any other place.
So should be bad U7800...

threads.title: 820-00840 No Boot missing PP5v_S5
threads.message:
reaplaced u7800 rails are now up board is using 20v 0.6a then drop to .3a after 10 seconds and stays there
L7210/20 = 0.6v
L7370 = 0.8v
L7410/20/30 = 0v

cpu is getting warm

threads.title: 820-00840 No Boot missing PP5v_S5
threads.message:
ultrasonic and now working.
Thank you for your input

threads.title: 820-00840 No Boot missing PP5v_S5
threads.message:
Graphics voltage (VCCGT) is the last will appear; maybe only under graphics load.
Any way to compare CPU Core voltage (VCCCPU) with a working board?
You don't see liquid signs, but smell of shampoo could mean dead CPU...

threads.title: 820-00840 No Boot missing PP5v_S5
threads.message: Probably was some stuff under cpu or one of the chips after UC all working

threads.title: 820-00840 No Boot missing PP5v_S5
threads.message: I suppose corrosion between CPU balls...
